e="preserve">A unit vector is any vector that is one unit in length. Unit vectors are often notated the same way as normal vectors, but with a mark over the letter (e.g. formula_1 being the unit vector of formula_1.)
To make a vector into a unit vector, one just needs to divide it by its length: formula_1. The resulting unit vector will be in the same direction as the original vector.
In component form.
Three common unit vectors used in component form are formula_1, formula_1 and formula_1, referring to the three-dimensional unit vectors for the x-, y- and z-axes, respectively. They are commonly just notated as i, j and k.
formula_1
For the unit vector corresponding to the formula_1-th basis vector of a vector space, the symbol formula_1 (or formula_1) may be used.
